title: How does one configure Internet settings for Alliance broadband? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1. Click on RUN and type ncpa.cpl 2. OK 3. Right click on Ethernet to go to its "Properties" 4. Go to the Networking Tab and select Internet Protocol Version 4(TCP/IP) and click on properties 5. Put the IP address, Subnet mask, default gateway and details of DNS server. Your network provider will give you these details. 6. Click on OK Your Alliance connection has been set. 7. Select your preferable browser to go to their connection homepage. Login with your user id and password (as given by your network provider).  Once successfully set up and logged in, you will get the service status message "Your Internet connection is configured properly." You can now use the internet.

Find My Network Places on your desktop.Right click on it And go to properties.Then double click on local Network Connection.Or you can do this way--Go to Control Panel-> click on network connection -> then click on local area network Then go to Internet protocol TCP/IP, Double click on that . On general tab select "Use the following IP address. Put on IP address,subnet mask, gateway address, and DNS address properly, which is given from your service provider. click OK, next OK. Now check your IP address is properly assigned or not.Go to Run, write down "cmd" and click on ok.Then in the command prompt write "ipconfig /all" ,press Enter: ISP - Internet Service Provider a Milano will show your IP address assigned.
